meanings.definition: A device used to measure the concentration of salt in a solution.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a salimeter to check how much salt was in the water.
meanings.sent2: The salimeter showed that the ocean water had a high salt concentration.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly used the salimeter to measure sugar in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a salimeter, always able to detect the slightest hint of salt in the food.
meanings.sent5: The salimeter beeped loudly when it detected a high level of salt in the solution.

meanings.definition: A tool for determining the salinity of water.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman relied on the salimeter to check if the water was suitable for fishing.
meanings.sent2: The salimeter indicated that the lake had a low salinity level.
meanings.sent3: The kids used the salimeter as a toy to pretend they were measuring magical water.
meanings.sent4: His words had a salimeter-like precision, always hitting the exact point he wanted to make.
meanings.sent5: The salimeter floated effortlessly on the water, silently measuring the salinity below.
